alert.note: Alert for Johnson (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 08 at 1:16PM MST until February 08 at 2:00PM MST by NWS Riverton
info.description: The National Weather Service in Riverton has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... South central Johnson County in north central Wyoming... * Until 200 PM MST. * At 115 PM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located 9 miles northeast of Mayoworth, or 13 miles north of Kaycee, moving south at 25 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and rapidly falling visibility. Wind gusts up to 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar and trained spotter. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes Interstate 25 between mile markers 236 and 288. Locations impacted include... Kaycee. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. SNOW SQUALL...OBSERVED
